intro: Pedicularis villosula var. parvifolia, commonly known as the hairy monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with a distinctive bilabiate structure. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats at high altitudes.
